Think carefully about whether you want to execute this script. It will overwrite same-named data in your project Data folder.



```{r}
library(purrr)
library("googledrive")
library(data.table)
```


# Create data direcotries on your local machine
```{r}
#data
ifelse(!dir.exists("data&scripts/data"), 
       dir.create("data&scripts/data"), 
       "Folder exists already")

#inputs
ifelse(!dir.exists("data&scripts/data/input"), 
       dir.create("data&scripts/data/input"), 
       "Folder exists already")

#outputs
ifelse(!dir.exists("data&scripts/data/output"), 
       dir.create("data&scripts/data/output"), 
       "Folder exists already")
```

# Download files from Gdrive
```{r}
drive_auth(email = FALSE)
  
  
  # store folder url as a file ID
  # identify this folder on Drive
  # let googledrive know this is a file ID or URL, as opposed to file name
datafolder <- drive_get(
  as_id("https://drive.google.com/drive/u/1/folders/1Rb9RB1q8OIc6V0BCwC9OVvGXfcuGx6RQ")) #ZM/WAE - HK Data folder in Hansen GDrive

    
  # identify the csv files in each folder
input_files <- data.table(drive_ls(datafolder))

#input_files <-  input_files %>% dplyr::filter(str_detect(name, ".csv"))
  
# download them, overwriting your currrent project data folder:
walk(input_files$id, ~ drive_download(as_id(.x), path = paste("data&scripts/data/input", input_files[id==.x, name], sep = "/"), overwrite = T ))

```
